note.p: Birth: Maltby Hall, near Rotherham, Yorkshire, England (30 July 1829)
Research Field: Comparative anatomy, zoology, archaeology, anthropology
Education: Pembroke College, Oxford; St Bartholomew's Hospital, London. BA (1850, 1st Class), MD; MA

Career: Fellow of Pembroke College (1851); Staff, British Civil Hospital, Smyrna (during Crimean War); Assistant Physician, Children's Hospital, London; Lee's Reader in Anatomy, Christ Church College, Oxford (1857); Linacre Professor of Anatomy and Physiology, University of Oxford (1860); Fellow, Merton College, Oxford (1872); died of uraemic convulsions
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1881-1882 vol 33 pp xxiv-xxvii signed by W H F
